exercises.title: Get an Address
exercises.description: Create an integer variable, get its address using &, and print both the value and the address.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Create an integer variable, get its address using &, and print both the value and the address.
exercises.solution:
x := 42
ptr := &x
fmt.Println("Value:", x)
fmt.Println("Address:", ptr)

exercises.title: Modify Through Pointer
exercises.description: Create a variable, get a pointer to it, then change the value using *ptr = newValue. Print before and after.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Create a variable, get a pointer to it, then change the value using *ptr = newValue. Print before and after.
exercises.solution:
x := 10
fmt.Println("Before:", x)
ptr := &x
*ptr = 50
fmt.Println("After:", x)  // 50

exercises.descriptionHtml: Write func double(n *int) that doubles the value at the pointer.

exercises.title: Check for nil
exercises.description: Write a function func printValue(p *int) that prints the value if p is not nil, or prints "pointer is nil" if it is.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Write a function func printValue(p *int) that prints the value if p is not nil, or prints "pointer is nil" if it is.

exercises.title: Swap
exercises.description: Write a function func swap(a, b *int) that swaps two integers using pointers.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Write a function func swap(a, b *int) that swaps two integers using pointers.

hints.title: ðŸ’¡ Hint
hints.content: Dereference both pointers, swap the values. Use parallel assignment: `*a, *b = *b, *a`

exercises.title: Counter Struct
exercises.description: Create a Counter struct with an int value. Add methods Increment(), Decrement(), and Value() int.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Create a Counter struct with an int value. Add methods Increment(), Decrement(), and Value() int.

hints.title: ðŸ’¡ Hint
hints.content: `Increment` and `Decrement` need pointer receivers to modify the struct. `Value` can use value receiver.

exercises.expected:
c := Counter{}
c.Increment()
c.Increment()
c.Decrement()
fmt.Println(c.Value()) // 1

exercises.title: Safe Dereference
exercises.description: Write func safeDeref(p *string) string that returns the string value if p is not nil, or "<nil>" if it is.
exercises.descriptionHtml: Write func safeDeref(p *string) string that returns the string value if p is not nil, or "<nil>" if it is.

hints.title: ðŸ’¡ Hint
hints.content: Check `p == nil` before dereferencing. Return the fallback string if nil.
